data.title: Robert
authors: Contributors to Wikinamia - The Name Wiki Encyclopedia Wiki
data.meta_description: The name Robert is an ancient Germanic given name. It is a modern form of the ancient Germanic given name Hrōþiberhtaz, derived from Proto-Germanic stems *Hrōþi- "fame, honour, godlike" and *berhta- "bright". Compare Old Dutch Robrecht and Old High German Hrodebert (a compound of Hruod (Old...
data.meta_site_name: Wikinamia - The Name Wiki Encyclopedia Wiki
data.text:
The name Robert was a royal name in France, Germany, Scotland and England during the medieval period, and was the name of several kings, dukes, and other rulers and noblemen. It was one of the most popular male names in medieval Europe, likely due to its frequent usage amongst royalty and nobility. To this day, Robert, and its different forms, remains one of the most frequently given male names.

Robert was in the top 10 most given boys' names in the United States for 47 years, from 1925 to 1972. While some names become less frequently used due to negative associations, Robert is still widely used despite its connection to many negatively evaluated historical figures, such as King Robert II of France, principal architect of Vietnam War, recognized war criminal, and US Secretary of Defence Robert McNamara, Dictator of Zimbabwe Robert Mugabe, Auschwitz extermination camp commander Robert Mulka, Soviet politician, provincial head of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union in Siberia and one of the perpetrators of the Great Purge Robert Eikhe, DAF Führer of Nazi Germany Robert Ley and Military Dictator of British India Baron Robert Clive.

The name's second component, *berhta-, is the original root for the modern English word "bright".

The names first and second elements can also be found in several other given names, as well as the name shares a similar meaning with a number of other given names (see names with a similar meaning section).

The names most famous namesake is King Robert I of Scotland, the King of Scots who defeated England in the Wars of Scottish Independence and became the national hero and patron of Scotland.

It was the name of 3 Kings of Scotland, 2 Kings of France, King of Germany, King of Naples, King of Hungary and Croatia, King of Albania and Tzar Robert (Boris) of Bulgaria who led Bulgaria during World War II and personally oversaw and commanded the Bulgarian troops on the European Theatre of World War II.

It was also the name of two Dukes of Normandy, Robert I "The Magnificent" and Robert Curthose who was one of the principal leaders of the First Crusade.

Robert was the name of 5 saints, most notably Saint Robert of Molesme who founded the Cistercian Order and Saint Robert Bellarmine, a Jesuit Doctor of the Church who, although canonized as a saint, became notorious for his participation in mass executions during the Roman Inquisition.

Robert was the name of 5 Prime Ministers of Great Britain, including Sir Robert Walpole who served as the first Prime Minister in history of Britain and led the War of Austrian Succession, Lord Robert Gascoyne-Cecil who led the Second Boer War, Sir Robert Peel who founded the Metropolitan police and led britain during the First Opium War and Lord Robert Jenkinson who led the War of the Sixth Coalition and Gunboat War, although mostly remembered for having a central role in the Napoleonic Wars. It was also the name of Sir Robert Menzies who was the longest serving Prime Minister in Australias history and led the country during Malayan Emergency and Robert Schumann, the Prime Minister of France who was also one of the founders of European Union and NATO. It is also the name of Robert Kocharyan, president of Armenia who previously served as an army general and was one of the principal military leaders of First Nagorno-Karabakh War.

Other significant politicians with this name were Robert A. Lovett who was the Secretary of defence of the United States and the principal leader of Korean War and Berlin Blockade, Secretary of Defence and CIA director Robert Gates who led US army during the Iraq War, and Robert F. Kennedy, United States Attorney General best known for his leadership during the Cuban Missile Crisis and Bay of Pigs Invasion. It was also the name of Robert McNamara, the United States Secretary of Defense and a recognized war criminal who became known for starting the american phase of the Vietnam War by ordering to invade Vietnam and for being the principal architect and leader of the war.

Robert was the name of Baron Robert Clive, an English nobleman and general who became the Commander-in-chief of British India, served as the Head of State of India and led the Indian army as one of the principal military leaders of Carnatic wars and Seven Years' War. It was the name of Roberto Viola, the Military Dictator of Argentina during the Dirty War period. It was also the name of Robert Mugabe, the Dictator of Zimbabwe who was in power for over 30 years and led the Zimbabwean forces in armed conflicts such as Rhodesian Bush War, Kivu Conflict and Second Congo War.

Robert was also the name of several important military commanders, including Robert L. Eichelberger, American general who commanded many important World War II battles, most notably Philippines Campaign (1944-1945), Landing at Aitape, New Guinea Campaign,Invasion of Palawan and Operation Downfall, as well as important military campaigns during World War I, including Siberian Intervention and Allied intervention in the Russian Civil War, Robert E. Lee, the supreme commander-in-chief of Confederate States army during American Civil War, Robert A. Lewis, the pilot and commander of the plane that dropped the atomic bomb "Little Boy" during the Atomic Bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, Baron Robert Baden-Powell, the founder of Girl Guide and Boy Scout movements and one of the principal leaders of Second Boer War and Anglo-Ashanti wars, Robert Blake who commanded the First Anglo-Dutch War, Robert Ritter von Greim who commanded German troops during the famous Battle of Kursk and Warsaw Uprising, Robert Viren who commanded Russian Naval forces during Russo-Japanese War and Robert Nivelle, the commander-in-chief of French army during WWI who was the principal commander of Western Front of World War I and Battle of Verdun, which is the longest battle in recorded history.

Other important military leaders with this name are Robert Dudley, governor-general of British Empire who most notably commanded the Eighty Years’ War and the Anglo-Spanish War, Robert Devereux, 2nd Earl of Essex, English nobleman and military commander who most notably commanded the English Armada and Irish Nine Years' War, Robert Devereux, 3rd Earl of Essex, best known for his leadership of English Civil War and Robert Stewart, Viscount Castlereagh who most notably led the Irish Rebellion of 1798.

Robert was the name of Robert Bunsen, Robert Koch, Robert Hooke and Robert Boyle, all of whom are comnsidered among the most important scientists in history, Robert L. Gilruth who was involved in Project Apollo which succeeded in preparing and landing the first humans on the Moon from 1968 to 1972, as well as Robert Oppenheimer, the inventor of the atomic bomb and leader of the Manhattan Project and Project Y, during which he and his team developed weapons of mass destruction.

Robert was also the name of Arctic explorers Robert Peary, who is also believed to be the first man to reach the North Pole and Robert Falcon Scott, the leader of the Terra Nova Expedition.

Other significant explorers with this name are Robert Ballard, a retired United States Navy officer and a professor of oceanography who discovered of the wrecks of the RMS Titanic, Robert O'Hara Burke, Irish soldier and police officer who explored Australia and led the first expedition to cross Australia from south to north and Sir Robert McClure, Irish explorer of the Arctic who traversed the Northwest Passage by boat and sledge and was the first to circumnavigate the Americas.

Today the name is best known for being the name of several famous actors, including Robert Downey Jr., Robert De Niro, Robert Pattinson and Robert Redford. All of them are considered among the most famous actors of all time. It is also the name of several film directors, including Robert Zemeckis, Robert Rodriguez, Robert "Rob" Reiner, Robert Eggers, Robert "Rob" Marshall, Robert Mulligan, Robert Schwentke, Robert Stevenson, Robert Stromberg and Robert Wise, all of whom are among the most highly visible film directors in history and have directed numerous films in genres spanning from adventure, horror and fantasy to psychological fims and thrillers.

It is also the name of the famous Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) leader Robert S. Mueller III.
